docs.description: Require that function overload signatures be consecutive
Require consistently using either `T[]` or `Array<T>` for arrays

messages.errorStringGeneric: Array type using '{{readonlyPrefix}}{{type}}[]' is forbidden. Use '{{className}}<{{type}}>' instead.
messages.errorStringArray: Array type using '{{className}}<{{type}}>' is forbidden. Use '{{readonlyPrefix}}{{type}}[]' instead.
messages.errorStringArraySimple: Array type using '{{className}}<{{type}}>' is forbidden for simple types. Use '{{readonlyPrefix}}{{type}}[]' instead.
messages.errorStringGenericSimple: Array type using '{{readonlyPrefix}}{{type}}[]' is forbidden for non-simple types. Use '{{className}}<{{type}}>' instead.

default.description: The array type expected for mutable cases.

readonly.description: The array type expected for readonly cases. If omitted, the value for `default` will be used.

docs.description: Disallow awaiting a value that is not a Thenable
Disallow `@ts-<directive>` comments or require descriptions after directives

messages.tsDirectiveComment: Do not use "@ts-{{directive}}" because it alters compilation errors.
messages.tsIgnoreInsteadOfExpectError: Use "@ts-expect-error" instead of "@ts-ignore", as "@ts-ignore" will do nothing if the following line is error-free.
messages.tsDirectiveCommentRequiresDescription: Include a description after the "@ts-{{directive}}" directive to explain why the @ts-{{directive}} is necessary. The description must be {{minimumDescriptionLength}} characters or longer.
messages.tsDirectiveCommentDescriptionNotMatchPat: The description for the "@ts-{{directive}}" directive must match the {{format}} format.

docs.description: Disallow `// tslint:<rule-flag>` comments
Disallow certain types

oneOf.description: Bans the type with the default message
Un-bans the type (useful when paired with `extendDefaults`)
Bans the type with the default message
Bans the type with a custom message

fixWith.description: Type to autofix replace with. Note that autofixers can be applied automatically - so you need to be careful with this option.

docs.description: Disallow or enforce spaces inside of blocks after opening block and before closing block
Enforce consistent brace style for blocks

messages.nextLineOpen: Opening curly brace does not appear on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.sameLineOpen: Opening curly brace appears on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.blockSameLine: Statement inside of curly braces should be on next line.
messages.nextLineClose: Closing curly brace does not appear on the same line as the subsequent block.
messages.singleLineClose: Closing curly brace should be on the same line as opening curly brace or on the line after the previous block.
messages.sameLineClose: Closing curly brace appears on the same line as the subsequent block.

docs.description: Enforce that literals on classes are exposed in a consistent style

messages.preferFieldStyle: Literals should be exposed using readonly fields.
messages.preferFieldStyleSuggestion: Replace the literals with readonly fields.
messages.preferGetterStyle: Literals should be exposed using getters.

docs.description: Enforce that class methods utilize `this`

exceptMethods.description: Allows specified method names to be ignored with this rule

enforceForClassFields.description: Enforces that functions used as instance field initializers utilize `this`

ignoreOverrideMethods.description: Ignore members marked with the `override` modifier

oneOf.description: Ignore all classes that implement an interface
Ignore only the public fields of classes that implement an interface

ignoreClassesThatImplementAnInterface.description: Ignore classes that specifically implement some interface

messages.missingThis: Expected 'this' to be used by class {{name}}.

docs.description: Require or disallow trailing commas
Enforce consistent spacing before and after commas
Enforce specifying generic type arguments on type annotation or constructor name of a constructor call

messages.preferTypeAnnotation: The generic type arguments should be specified as part of the type annotation.
messages.preferConstructor: The generic type arguments should be specified as part of the constructor type arguments.

docs.description: Require or disallow the `Record` type

messages.preferRecord: A record is preferred over an index signature.
messages.preferIndexSignature: An index signature is preferred over a record.

docs.description: Require `return` statements to either always or never specify values

messages.missingReturn: Expected to return a value at the end of {{name}}.

docs.description: Enforce consistent usage of type assertions

messages.never: Do not use any type assertions.

docs.description: Enforce type definitions to consistently use either `interface` or `type`
Enforce consistent usage of type exports

messages.typeOverValue: All exports in the declaration are only used as types. Use `export type`.
messages.singleExportIsType: Type export {{exportNames}} is not a value and should be exported using `export type`.
messages.multipleExportsAreTypes: Type exports {{exportNames}} are not values and should be exported using `export type`.

docs.description: Enforce consistent usage of type imports

messages.typeOverValue: All imports in the declaration are only used as types. Use `import type`.
messages.someImportsAreOnlyTypes: Imports {{typeImports}} are only used as type.
messages.avoidImportType: Use an `import` instead of an `import type`.

docs.description: Enforce default parameters to be last
Enforce dot notation whenever possible

messages.useDot: [{{key}}] is better written in dot notation.

docs.description: Require explicit return types on functions and class methods

allowConciseArrowFunctionExpressionsStar.description: Whether to allow arrow functions that start with the `void` keyword.

allowExpressions.description: Whether to ignore function expressions (functions which are not part of a declaration).

allowHigherOrderFunctions.description: Whether to ignore functions immediately returning another function expression.

allowTypedFunctionExpressions.description: Whether to ignore type annotations on the variable of function expressions.

allowDirectConstAssertionInArrowFunction.description: Whether to ignore arrow functions immediately returning a `as const` value.

allowFunctionsWithoutTypeParameters.description: Whether to ignore functions that don't have generic type parameters.

allowedNames.description: An array of function/method names that will not have their arguments or return values checked.

allowIIFEs.description: Whether to ignore immediately invoked function expressions (IIFEs).

docs.description: Require explicit accessibility modifiers on class properties and methods

oneOf.description: Require an accessor except when public.
Never check whether there is an accessor.

docs.description: Require explicit return and argument types on exported functions' and classes' public class methods

messages.anyTypedArg: Argument '{{name}}' should be typed with a non-any type.
messages.anyTypedArgUnnamed: {{type}} argument should be typed with a non-any type.

allowArgumentsExplicitlyTypedAsAny.description: Whether to ignore arguments that are explicitly typed as `any`.

allowDirectConstAssertionInArrowFunction.description:
Whether to ignore return type annotations on body-less arrow functions that return an `as const` type assertion.
You must still type the parameters of the function.

allowedNames.description: An array of function/method names that will not have their arguments or return values checked.

allowHigherOrderFunctions.description:
Whether to ignore return type annotations on functions immediately returning another function expression.
You must still type the parameters of the function.

allowTypedFunctionExpressions.description: Whether to ignore type annotations on the variable of a function expression.

docs.description: Require or disallow spacing between function identifiers and their invocations

messages.unexpectedWhitespace: Unexpected whitespace between function name and paren.
messages.unexpectedNewline: Unexpected newline between function name and paren.
messages.missing: Missing space between function name and paren.

docs.description: Enforce consistent indentation
Require or disallow initialization in variable declarations

messages.initialized: Variable '{{idName}}' should be initialized on declaration.
messages.notInitialized: Variable '{{idName}}' should not be initialized on declaration.

docs.description: Enforce consistent spacing between property names and type annotations in types and interfaces
Enforce consistent spacing before and after keywords
Require empty lines around comments
Require or disallow an empty line between class members

messages.never: Unexpected blank line between class members.
messages.always: Expected blank line between class members.

docs.description: Enforce a maximum number of parameters in function definitions

messages.exceed: {{name}} has too many parameters ({{count}}). Maximum allowed is {{max}}.

docs.description: Require a specific member delimiter style for interfaces and type literals
Require a consistent member declaration order

messages.incorrectOrder: Member {{member}} should be declared before member {{beforeMember}}.
messages.incorrectGroupOrder: Member {{name}} should be declared before all {{rank}} definitions.
messages.incorrectRequiredMembersOrder: Member {{member}} should be declared after all {{optionalOrRequired}} members.

docs.description: Enforce using a particular method signature syntax

messages.errorMethod: Shorthand method signature is forbidden. Use a function property instead.
messages.errorProperty: Function property signature is forbidden. Use a method shorthand instead.

docs.description: Enforce naming conventions for everything across a codebase

messages.unexpectedUnderscore: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must not have a {{position}} underscore.
messages.missingAffix: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must have one of the following {{position}}es: {{affixes}}
messages.doesNotMatchFormat: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must match one of the following formats: {{formats}}
messages.doesNotMatchFormatTrimmed: {{type}} name `{{name}}` trimmed as `{{processedName}}` must match one of the following formats: {{formats}}

docs.description: Disallow generic `Array` constructors

messages.useLiteral: The array literal notation [] is preferable.

docs.description: Disallow using the `delete` operator on array values

messages.noArrayDelete: Using the `delete` operator with an array expression is unsafe.

docs.description: Require `.toString()` to only be called on objects which provide useful information when stringified
Disallow non-null assertion in locations that may be confusing

messages.confusingEqual: Confusing combinations of non-null assertion and equal test like "a! == b", which looks very similar to not equal "a !== b".
messages.confusingAssign: Confusing combinations of non-null assertion and equal test like "a! = b", which looks very similar to not equal "a != b".
messages.notNeedInEqualTest: Unnecessary non-null assertion (!) in equal test.
messages.notNeedInAssign: Unnecessary non-null assertion (!) in assignment left hand.
messages.wrapUpLeft: Wrap up left hand to avoid putting non-null assertion "!" and "=" together.

docs.description: Require expressions of type void to appear in statement position

messages.invalidVoidExpr: Placing a void expression inside another expression is forbidden. Move it to its own statement instead.
messages.invalidVoidExprWrapVoid: Void expressions used inside another expression must be moved to its own statement or marked explicitly with the `void` operator.
messages.invalidVoidExprArrow: Returning a void expression from an arrow function shorthand is forbidden. Please add braces to the arrow function.
messages.invalidVoidExprArrowWrapVoid: Void expressions returned from an arrow function shorthand must be marked explicitly with the `void` operator.
messages.invalidVoidExprReturn: Returning a void expression from a function is forbidden. Please move it before the `return` statement.
messages.invalidVoidExprReturnLast: Returning a void expression from a function is forbidden. Please remove the `return` statement.
messages.invalidVoidExprReturnWrapVoid: Void expressions returned from a function must be marked explicitly with the `void` operator.

docs.description: Disallow duplicate class members
Disallow duplicate enum member values
Disallow duplicate constituents of union or intersection types
Disallow using the `delete` operator on computed key expressions

messages.dynamicDelete: Do not delete dynamically computed property keys.

docs.description: Disallow empty functions
Disallow the declaration of empty interfaces

messages.noEmpty: An empty interface is equivalent to `{}`.
messages.noEmptyWithSuper: An interface declaring no members is equivalent to its supertype.

docs.description: Disallow the `any` type

messages.unexpectedAny: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.
messages.suggestUnknown: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
messages.suggestNever: Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

fixToUnknown.description: Whether to enable auto-fixing in which the `any` type is converted to the `unknown` type.

ignoreRestArgs.description: Whether to ignore rest parameter arrays.

docs.description: Disallow extra non-null assertions
Disallow unnecessary parentheses
Disallow unnecessary semicolons
Disallow classes used as namespaces

allowConstructorOnly.description: Whether to allow extraneous classes that contain only a constructor.

allowEmpty.description: Whether to allow extraneous classes that have no body (i.e. are empty).

allowStaticOnly.description: Whether to allow extraneous classes that only contain static members.

allowWithDecorator.description: Whether to allow extraneous classes that include a decorator.

messages.onlyStatic: Unexpected class with only static properties.
messages.onlyConstructor: Unexpected class with only a constructor.

docs.description: Require Promise-like statements to be handled appropriately

messages.floating: Promises must be awaited, end with a call to .catch, or end with a call to .then with a rejection handler.
messages.floatingVoid: Promises must be awaited, end with a call to .catch, end with a call to .then with a rejection handler or be explicitly marked as ignored with the `void` operator.
messages.floatingUselessRejectionHandler: Promises must be awaited, end with a call to .catch, or end with a call to .then with a rejection handler. A rejection handler that is not a function will be ignored.
messages.floatingUselessRejectionHandlerVoid: Promises must be awaited, end with a call to .catch, end with a call to .then with a rejection handler or be explicitly marked as ignored with the `void` operator. A rejection handler that is not a function will be ignored.
messages.floatingPromiseArray: An array of Promises may be unintentional. Consider handling the promises' fulfillment or rejection with Promise.all or similar.
messages.floatingPromiseArrayVoid: An array of Promises may be unintentional. Consider handling the promises' fulfillment or rejection with Promise.all or similar, or explicitly marking the expression as ignored with the `void` operator.

ignoreIIFE.description: Whether to ignore async IIFEs (Immediately Invoked Function Expressions).

docs.description: Disallow iterating over an array with a for-in loop

messages.forInViolation: For-in loops over arrays skips holes, returns indices as strings, and may visit the prototype chain or other enumerable properties. Use a more robust iteration method such as for-of or array.forEach instead.

docs.description: Disallow the use of `eval()`-like methods

messages.noImpliedEvalError: Implied eval. Consider passing a function.
messages.noFunctionConstructor: Implied eval. Do not use the Function constructor to create functions.

docs.description: Enforce the use of top-level import type qualifier when an import only has specifiers with inline type qualifiers

messages.useTopLevelQualifier: TypeScript will only remove the inline type specifiers which will leave behind a side effect import at runtime. Convert this to a top-level type qualifier to properly remove the entire import.

docs.description: Disallow explicit type declarations for variables or parameters initialized to a number, string, or boolean

messages.noInferrableType: Type {{type}} trivially inferred from a {{type}} literal, remove type annotation.

docs.description: Disallow `this` keywords outside of classes or class-like objects
Disallow `void` type outside of generic or return types

messages.invalidVoidForGeneric: {{ generic }} may not have void as a type argument.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrGeneric: void is only valid as a return type or generic type argument.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturn: void is only valid as a return type.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrThisParam: void is only valid as return type or type of `this` parameter.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrThisParamOrGeneric: void is only valid as a return type or generic type argument or the type of a `this` parameter.
messages.invalidVoidUnionConstituent: void is not valid as a constituent in a union type

docs.description: Disallow function declarations that contain unsafe references inside loop statements

messages.unsafeRefs: Function declared in a loop contains unsafe references to variable(s) {{ varNames }}.

docs.description: Disallow literal numbers that lose precision

messages.noLossOfPrecision: This number literal will lose precision at runtime.

docs.description: Disallow magic numbers
Disallow the `void` operator except when used to discard a value

messages.meaninglessVoidOperator: void operator shouldn't be used on {{type}}; it should convey that a return value is being ignored

docs.description: Enforce valid definition of `new` and `constructor`

messages.errorMessageInterface: Interfaces cannot be constructed, only classes.

docs.description: Disallow Promises in places not designed to handle them

messages.voidReturnArgument: Promise returned in function argument where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnVariable: Promise-returning function provided to variable where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnProperty: Promise-returning function provided to property where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnReturnValue: Promise-returning function provided to return value where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnAttribute: Promise-returning function provided to attribute where a void return was expected.
messages.conditional: Expected non-Promise value in a boolean conditional.
messages.spread: Expected a non-Promise value to be spreaded in an object.

docs.description: Disallow enums from having both number and string members

messages.mixed: Mixing number and string enums can be confusing.

docs.description: Disallow TypeScript namespaces

messages.moduleSyntaxIsPreferred: ES2015 module syntax is preferred over namespaces.

allowDeclarations.description: Whether to allow `declare` with custom TypeScript namespaces.

allowDefinitionFiles.description: Whether to allow `declare` with custom TypeScript namespaces inside definition files.

docs.description: Disallow non-null assertions in the left operand of a nullish coalescing operator

messages.noNonNullAssertedNullishCoalescing: The nullish coalescing operator is designed to handle undefined and null - using a non-null assertion is not needed.

docs.description: Disallow non-null assertions after an optional chain expression

messages.noNonNullOptionalChain: Optional chain expressions can return undefined by design - using a non-null assertion is unsafe and wrong.
messages.suggestRemovingNonNull: You should remove the non-null assertion.

docs.description: Disallow non-null assertions using the `!` postfix operator

messages.suggestOptionalChain: Consider using the optional chain operator `?.` instead. This operator includes runtime checks, so it is safer than the compile-only non-null assertion operator.

docs.description: Disallow variable redeclaration

messages.redeclaredAsBuiltin: '{{id}}' is already defined as a built-in global variable.
messages.redeclaredBySyntax: '{{id}}' is already defined by a variable declaration.

docs.description: Disallow members of unions and intersections that do nothing or override type information

messages.literalOverridden: {{literal}} is overridden by {{primitive}} in this union type.
messages.primitiveOverridden: {{primitive}} is overridden by the {{literal}} in this intersection type.
messages.overridden: '{{typeName}}' is overridden by other types in this {{container}} type.
messages.overrides: '{{typeName}}' overrides all other types in this {{container}} type.

docs.description: Disallow invocation of `require()`

allow.description: Patterns of import paths to allow requiring from.

docs.description: Disallow specified modules when loaded by `import`

messages.path: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used.
messages.pathWithCustomMessage: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used. {{customMessage}}
messages.patterns: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used by a pattern.
messages.patternWithCustomMessage: '{{importSource}}' import is restricted from being used by a pattern. {{customMessage}}
messages.patternAndImportName: '{{importName}}' import from '{{importSource}}' is restricted from being used by a pattern.
messages.patternAndImportNameWithCustomMessage: '{{importName}}' import from '{{importSource}}' is restricted from being used by a pattern. {{customMessage}}
messages.patternAndEverything: * import is invalid because '{{importNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is restricted from being used by a pattern.
messages.patternAndEverythingWithRegexImportName: * import is invalid because import name matching '{{importNames}}' pattern from '{{importSource}}' is restricted from being used.
messages.patternAndEverythingWithCustomMessage: * import is invalid because '{{importNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is restricted from being used by a pattern. {{customMessage}}
messages.patternAndEverythingWithRegexImportNameA: * import is invalid because import name matching '{{importNames}}' pattern from '{{importSource}}' is restricted from being used. {{customMessage}}
messages.everything: * import is invalid because '{{importNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is restricted.
messages.everythingWithCustomMessage: * import is invalid because '{{importNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is restricted. {{customMessage}}
messages.allowedImportName: '{{importName}}' import from '{{importSource}}' is restricted because only '{{allowedImportNames}}' import(s) is/are allowed.
messages.allowedImportNameWithCustomMessage: '{{importName}}' import from '{{importSource}}' is restricted because only '{{allowedImportNames}}' import(s) is/are allowed. {{customMessage}}
messages.everythingWithAllowImportNames: * import is invalid because only '{{allowedImportNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is/are allowed.
messages.everythingWithAllowImportNamesAndCustomM: * import is invalid because only '{{allowedImportNames}}' from '{{importSource}}' is/are allowed. {{customMessage}}
messages.allowedImportNamePattern: '{{importName}}' import from '{{importSource}}' is restricted because only imports that match the pattern '{{allowedImportNamePattern}}' are allowed from '{{importSource}}'.
messages.allowedImportNamePatternWithCustomMessag: '{{importName}}' import from '{{importSource}}' is restricted because only imports that match the pattern '{{allowedImportNamePattern}}' are allowed from '{{importSource}}'. {{customMessage}}
messages.everythingWithAllowedImportNamePattern: * import is invalid because only imports that match the pattern '{{allowedImportNamePattern}}' from '{{importSource}}' are allowed.
messages.everythingWithAllowedImportNamePatternWi: * import is invalid because only imports that match the pattern '{{allowedImportNamePattern}}' from '{{importSource}}' are allowed. {{customMessage}}

allowTypeImports.description: Disallow value imports, but allow type-only imports.
Disallow value imports, but allow type-only imports.
Disallow value imports, but allow type-only imports.

docs.description: Disallow variable declarations from shadowing variables declared in the outer scope

messages.noShadow: '{{name}}' is already declared in the upper scope on line {{shadowedLine}} column {{shadowedColumn}}.

docs.description: Disallow aliasing `this`

allowDestructuring.description: Whether to ignore destructurings, such as `const { props, state } = this`.

allowedNames.description: Names to ignore, such as ["self"] for `const self = this;`.

messages.thisAssignment: Unexpected aliasing of 'this' to local variable.
messages.thisDestructure: Unexpected aliasing of members of 'this' to local variables.

docs.description: Disallow throwing literals as exceptions

messages.object: Expected an error object to be thrown.

docs.description: Disallow type aliases

allowAliases.description: Whether to allow direct one-to-one type aliases.

allowCallbacks.description: Whether to allow type aliases for callbacks.

allowConditionalTypes.description: Whether to allow type aliases for conditional types.

allowConstructors.description: Whether to allow type aliases with constructors.

allowLiterals.description: Whether to allow type aliases with object literal types.

allowMappedTypes.description: Whether to allow type aliases with mapped types.

allowTupleTypes.description: Whether to allow type aliases with tuple types.

allowGenerics.description: Whether to allow type aliases with generic types.

docs.description: Disallow unnecessary equality comparisons against boolean literals

messages.direct: This expression unnecessarily compares a boolean value to a boolean instead of using it directly.
messages.negated: This expression unnecessarily compares a boolean value to a boolean instead of negating it.
messages.comparingNullableToTrueDirect: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to true instead of using it directly.
messages.comparingNullableToTrueNegated: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to true instead of negating it.
messages.comparingNullableToFalse: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to false instead of using the ?? operator to provide a default.

allowComparingNullableBooleansToTrue.description: Whether to allow comparisons between nullable boolean variables and `true`.

allowComparingNullableBooleansToFalse.description: Whether to allow comparisons between nullable boolean variables and `false`.

docs.description: Disallow conditionals where the type is always truthy or always falsy

allowConstantLoopConditions.description: Whether to ignore constant loop conditions, such as `while (true)`.

allowRuleToRunWithoutStrictNullChecksIKn.description: Whether to not error when running with a tsconfig that has strictNullChecks turned.

messages.alwaysTruthy: Unnecessary conditional, value is always truthy.
messages.alwaysFalsy: Unnecessary conditional, value is always falsy.
messages.alwaysTruthyFunc: This callback should return a conditional, but return is always truthy.
messages.alwaysFalsyFunc: This callback should return a conditional, but return is always falsy.
messages.neverNullish: Unnecessary conditional, expected left-hand side of `??` operator to be possibly null or undefined.
messages.alwaysNullish: Unnecessary conditional, left-hand side of `??` operator is always `null` or `undefined`.
messages.literalBooleanExpression: Unnecessary conditional, both sides of the expression are literal values.
messages.noOverlapBooleanExpression: Unnecessary conditional, the types have no overlap.
messages.neverOptionalChain: Unnecessary optional chain on a non-nullish value.
messages.noStrictNullCheck: This rule requires the `strictNullChecks` compiler option to be turned on to function correctly.

docs.description: Disallow unnecessary namespace qualifiers

messages.unnecessaryQualifier: Qualifier is unnecessary since '{{ name }}' is in scope.

docs.description: Disallow unnecessary template expressions

messages.noUnnecessaryTemplateExpression: Template literal expression is unnecessary and can be simplified.

docs.description: Disallow type arguments that are equal to the default

messages.unnecessaryTypeParameter: This is the default value for this type parameter, so it can be omitted.

docs.description: Disallow type assertions that do not change the type of an expression

messages.unnecessaryAssertion: This assertion is unnecessary since it does not change the type of the expression.
messages.contextuallyUnnecessary: This assertion is unnecessary since the receiver accepts the original type of the expression.

typesToIgnore.description: A list of type names to ignore.

docs.description: Disallow unnecessary constraints on generic types

messages.unnecessaryConstraint: Constraining the generic type `{{name}}` to `{{constraint}}` does nothing and is unnecessary.

docs.description: Disallow calling a function with a value with type `any`

messages.unsafeArgument: Unsafe argument of type `{{sender}}` assigned to a parameter of type `{{receiver}}`.
messages.unsafeTupleSpread: Unsafe spread of a tuple type. The argument is of type `{{sender}}` and is assigned to a parameter of type `{{receiver}}`.
messages.unsafeArraySpread: Unsafe spread of an `any` array type.

docs.description: Disallow assigning a value with type `any` to variables and properties

messages.anyAssignmentThis:
Unsafe assignment of an `any` value. `this` is typed as `any`.
You can try to fix this by turning on the `noImplicitThis` compiler option, or adding a `this` parameter to the function.
messages.unsafeArrayPattern: Unsafe array destructuring of an `any` array value.
messages.unsafeArrayPatternFromTuple: Unsafe array destructuring of a tuple element with an `any` value.
messages.unsafeAssignment: Unsafe assignment of type {{sender}} to a variable of type {{receiver}}.
messages.unsafeArraySpread: Unsafe spread of an `any` value in an array.

docs.description: Disallow calling a value with type `any`

messages.unsafeCall: Unsafe call of an `any` typed value.
messages.unsafeCallThis:
Unsafe call of an `any` typed value. `this` is typed as `any`.
You can try to fix this by turning on the `noImplicitThis` compiler option, or adding a `this` parameter to the function.
messages.unsafeNew: Unsafe construction of an any type value.

docs.description: Disallow unsafe declaration merging

messages.unsafeMerging: Unsafe declaration merging between classes and interfaces.

docs.description: Disallow comparing an enum value with a non-enum value

messages.mismatchedCase: The case statement does not have a shared enum type with the switch predicate.
messages.mismatchedCondition: The two values in this comparison do not have a shared enum type.
messages.replaceValueWithEnum: Replace with an enum value comparison.

docs.description: Disallow member access on a value with type `any`

messages.unsafeMemberExpression: Unsafe member access {{property}} on an `any` value.
messages.unsafeThisMemberExpression:
Unsafe member access {{property}} on an `any` value. `this` is typed as `any`.
You can try to fix this by turning on the `noImplicitThis` compiler option, or adding a `this` parameter to the function.
messages.unsafeComputedMemberAccess: Computed name {{property}} resolves to an any value.

docs.description: Disallow returning a value with type `any` from a function

messages.unsafeReturn: Unsafe return of an `{{type}}` typed value.
messages.unsafeReturnThis:
Unsafe return of an `{{type}}` typed value. `this` is typed as `any`.
You can try to fix this by turning on the `noImplicitThis` compiler option, or adding a `this` parameter to the function.
messages.unsafeReturnAssignment: Unsafe return of type `{{sender}}` from function with return type `{{receiver}}`.

messages.unusedExpression: Expected an assignment or function call and instead saw an expression.

messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{token}}'.

messages.expectedBlankLine: Expected blank line before this statement.

messages.defineInitializer: The value of the member '{{ name }}' should be explicitly defined.
messages.defineInitializerSuggestion: Can be fixed to {{ name }} = {{ suggested }}

docs.description: Enforce the use of Array.prototype.find() over Array.prototype.filter() followed by [0] when looking for a single result
Enforce the use of `for-of` loop over the standard `for` loop where possible

messages.preferForOf: Expected a `for-of` loop instead of a `for` loop with this simple iteration.

docs.description: Enforce using function types instead of interfaces with call signatures

messages.functionTypeOverCallableType: {{ literalOrInterface }} only has a call signature, you should use a function type instead.
messages.unexpectedThisOnFunctionOnlyInterface: `this` refers to the function type '{{ interfaceName }}', did you intend to use a generic `this` parameter like `<Self>(this: Self, ...) => Self` instead?

docs.description: Enforce `includes` method over `indexOf` method

messages.preferStringIncludes: Use `String#includes()` method with a string instead.

docs.description: Require all enum members to be literal values

messages.notLiteral: Explicit enum value must only be a literal value (string, number, boolean, etc).

docs.description: Require using `namespace` keyword over `module` keyword to declare custom TypeScript modules

messages.useNamespace: Use 'namespace' instead of 'module' to declare custom TypeScript modules.

docs.description: Enforce using the nullish coalescing operator instead of logical assignments or chaining

messages.preferNullishOverOr: Prefer using nullish coalescing operator (`??`) instead of a logical or (`||`), as it is a safer operator.
messages.preferNullishOverTernary: Prefer using nullish coalescing operator (`??`) instead of a ternary expression, as it is simpler to read.
messages.noStrictNullCheck: This rule requires the `strictNullChecks` compiler option to be turned on to function correctly.

docs.description: Enforce using concise optional chain expressions instead of chained logical ands, negated logical ors, or empty objects

messages.preferOptionalChain: Prefer using an optional chain expression instead, as it's more concise and easier to read.

checkAny.description: Check operands that are typed as `any` when inspecting "loose boolean" operands.

checkUnknown.description: Check operands that are typed as `unknown` when inspecting "loose boolean" operands.

checkString.description: Check operands that are typed as `string` when inspecting "loose boolean" operands.

checkNumber.description: Check operands that are typed as `number` when inspecting "loose boolean" operands.

checkBoolean.description: Check operands that are typed as `boolean` when inspecting "loose boolean" operands.

checkBigInt.description: Check operands that are typed as `bigint` when inspecting "loose boolean" operands.

requireNullish.description: Skip operands that are not typed with `null` and/or `undefined` when inspecting "loose boolean" operands.

allowPotentiallyUnsafeFixesThatModifyThe.description: Allow autofixers that will change the return type of the expression. This option is considered unsafe as it may break the build.

docs.description: Require using Error objects as Promise rejection reasons

messages.rejectAnError: Expected the Promise rejection reason to be an Error.

docs.description: Require private members to be marked as `readonly` if they're never modified outside of the constructor

messages.preferReadonly: Member '{{name}}' is never reassigned; mark it as `readonly`.

docs.description: Require function parameters to be typed as `readonly` to prevent accidental mutation of inputs

messages.shouldBeReadonly: Parameter should be a read only type.

docs.description: Enforce using type parameter when calling `Array#reduce` instead of casting

messages.preferTypeParameter: Unnecessary cast: Array#reduce accepts a type parameter for the default value.

docs.description: Enforce `RegExp#exec` over `String#match` if no global flag is provided
Enforce that `this` is used when only `this` type is returned
Enforce using `String#startsWith` and `String#endsWith` over other equivalent methods of checking substrings

allowSingleElementEquality.description: Whether to allow equality checks against the first or last element of a string.

docs.description: Enforce using `@ts-expect-error` over `@ts-ignore`

messages.preferExpectErrorComment: Use "@ts-expect-error" to ensure an error is actually being suppressed.

docs.description: Require any function or method that returns a Promise to be marked async

messages.missingAsync: Functions that return promises must be async.

allowAny.description: Whether to consider `any` and `unknown` to be Promises.

allowedPromiseNames.description: Any extra names of classes or interfaces to be considered Promises.

docs.description: Enforce the consistent use of either backticks, double, or single quotes
Require `Array#sort` and `Array#toSorted` calls to always provide a `compareFunction`

ignoreStringArrays.description: Whether to ignore arrays in which all elements are strings.

docs.description: Disallow async functions which do not return promises and have no `await` expression
Require both operands of addition to be the same type and be `bigint`, `number`, or `string`

messages.bigintAndNumber: Numeric '+' operations must either be both bigints or both numbers. Got `{{left}}` + `{{right}}`.
messages.invalid: Invalid operand for a '+' operation. Operands must each be a number or {{stringLike}}. Got `{{type}}`.
messages.mismatched: Operands of '+' operations must be a number or {{stringLike}}. Got `{{left}}` + `{{right}}`.

allowNullish.description: Whether to allow potentially `null` or `undefined` typed values.

allowNumberAndString.description: Whether to allow `bigint`/`number` typed values and `string` typed values to be added together.

skipCompoundAssignments.description: Whether to skip compound assignments such as `+=`.

docs.description: Enforce template literal expressions to be of `string` type

messages.invalidType: Invalid type "{{type}}" of template literal expression.

allowAny.description: Whether to allow `any` typed values in template expressions.

allowArray.description: Whether to allow `array` typed values in template expressions.

allowBoolean.description: Whether to allow `boolean` typed values in template expressions.

allowNullish.description: Whether to allow `nullish` typed values in template expressions.

allowNumber.description: Whether to allow `number` typed values in template expressions.

allowRegExp.description: Whether to allow `regexp` typed values in template expressions.

allowNever.description: Whether to allow `never` typed values in template expressions.

docs.description: Enforce consistent returning of awaited values

messages.nonPromiseAwait: Returning an awaited value that is not a promise is not allowed.
messages.disallowedPromiseAwait: Returning an awaited promise is not allowed in this context.
messages.requiredPromiseAwait: Returning an awaited promise is required in this context.
messages.requiredPromiseAwaitSuggestion: Add `await` before the expression. Use caution as this may impact control flow.
messages.disallowedPromiseAwaitSuggestion: Remove `await` before the expression. Use caution as this may impact control flow.

docs.description: Require or disallow semicolons instead of ASI
Enforce constituents of a type union/intersection to be sorted alphabetically

messages.suggestFix: Sort constituents of type (removes all comments).

caseSensitive.description: Whether to sort using case sensitive sorting.

docs.description: Enforce consistent spacing before blocks
Enforce consistent spacing before function parenthesis
Require spacing around infix operators
Disallow certain types in boolean expressions

messages.conditionErrorOther: Unexpected value in conditional. A boolean expression is required.
messages.conditionErrorAny: Unexpected any value in conditional. An explicit comparison or type cast is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullish: Unexpected nullish value in conditional. The condition is always false.
messages.conditionErrorNullableBoolean: Unexpected nullable boolean value in conditional. Please handle the nullish case explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorString: Unexpected string value in conditional. An explicit empty string check is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullableString: Unexpected nullable string value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/empty cases explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorNumber: Unexpected number value in conditional. An explicit zero/NaN check is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullableNumber: Unexpected nullable number value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/zero/NaN cases explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorObject: Unexpected object value in conditional. The condition is always true.
messages.conditionErrorNullableObject: Unexpected nullable object value in conditional. An explicit null check is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullableEnum: Unexpected nullable enum value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/zero/NaN cases explicitly.
messages.noStrictNullCheck: This rule requires the `strictNullChecks` compiler option to be turned on to function correctly.
messages.conditionFixDefaultFalse: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as false (`value ?? false`)
messages.conditionFixDefaultEmptyString: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as an empty string (`value ?? ""`)
messages.conditionFixDefaultZero: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as 0 (`value ?? 0`)
messages.conditionFixCompareNullish: Change condition to check for null/undefined (`value != null`)
messages.conditionFixCastBoolean: Explicitly cast value to a boolean (`Boolean(value)`)
messages.conditionFixCompareTrue: Change condition to check if true (`value === true`)
messages.conditionFixCompareFalse: Change condition to check if false (`value === false`)
messages.conditionFixCompareStringLength: Change condition to check string's length (`value.length !== 0`)
messages.conditionFixCompareEmptyString: Change condition to check for empty string (`value !== ""`)
messages.conditionFixCompareNaN: Change condition to check for NaN (`!Number.isNaN(value)`)

docs.description: Require switch-case statements to be exhaustive

allowDefaultCaseForExhaustiveSwitch.description: If 'true', allow 'default' cases on switch statements with exhaustive cases.

requireDefaultForNonUnion.description: If 'true', require a 'default' clause for switches on non-union types.

messages.switchIsNotExhaustive: Switch is not exhaustive. Cases not matched: {{missingBranches}}
messages.dangerousDefaultCase: The switch statement is exhaustive, so the default case is unnecessary.

docs.description: Disallow certain triple slash directives in favor of ES6-style import declarations

messages.tripleSlashReference: Do not use a triple slash reference for {{module}}, use `import` style instead.

docs.description: Require consistent spacing around type annotations

messages.unexpectedSpaceBetween: Unexpected space between the '{{previousToken}}' and the '{{type}}'.

docs.description: Require type annotations in certain places

messages.expectedTypedefNamed: Expected {{name}} to have a type annotation.

docs.description: Enforce unbound methods are called with their expected scope

messages.unbound: Avoid referencing unbound methods which may cause unintentional scoping of `this`.
messages.unboundWithoutThisAnnotation:
Avoid referencing unbound methods which may cause unintentional scoping of `this`.
If your function does not access `this`, you can annotate it with `this: void`, or consider using an arrow function instead.

ignoreStatic.description: Whether to skip checking whether `static` methods are correctly bound.

docs.description: Disallow two overloads that could be unified into one with a union or an optional/rest parameter

ignoreDifferentlyNamedParameters.description: Whether two parameters with different names at the same index should be considered different even if their types are the same.

docs.description: Enforce typing arguments in `.catch()` callbacks as `unknown`

messages.useUnknown: Prefer the safe `: unknown` for a catch callback variable.
messages.useUnknownArrayDestructuringPattern: Prefer the safe `: unknown` for a catch callback variable. The thrown error may not be iterable.
messages.useUnknownObjectDestructuringPattern: Prefer the safe `: unknown` for a catch callback variable. The thrown error may be nullable, or may not have the expected shape.
messages.useUnknownSpreadArgs: Prefer the safe `: unknown` for a catch callback variable. The argument list may contain a handler that does not use `unknown` for the catch callback variable.
messages.addUnknownTypeAnnotationSuggestion: Add an explicit `: unknown` type annotation to the catch variable.
messages.addUnknownRestTypeAnnotationSuggestion: Add an explicit `: [unknown]` type annotation to the catch rest variable.
messages.wrongTypeAnnotationSuggestion: Change existing type annotation to `: unknown`.

docs.description: Enforce defaultProps declarations alphabetical sorting

messages.propsNotSorted: Default prop types declarations should be sorted alphabetically

docs.description: Enforce spacing before closing bracket in JSX

messages.noSpaceBeforeClose: A space is forbidden before closing bracket
messages.needSpaceBeforeClose: A space is required before closing bracket

docs.description: Enforces consistent naming for boolean props
Disallow usage of `button` elements without an explicit `type` attribute

messages.missingType: Missing an explicit type attribute for button
messages.complexType: The button type attribute must be specified by a static string or a trivial ternary expression
messages.invalidValue: "{{value}}" is an invalid value for button type attribute
messages.forbiddenValue: "{{value}}" is an invalid value for button type attribute

docs.description: Enforce using `onChange` or `readonly` attribute when `checked` is used

messages.missingProperty: `checked` should be used with either `onChange` or `readOnly`.
messages.exclusiveCheckedAttribute: Use either `checked` or `defaultChecked`, but not both.

docs.description: Enforce all defaultProps have a corresponding non-required PropType

messages.defaultHasNoType: defaultProp "{{name}}" has no corresponding propTypes declaration.

docs.description: Enforce consistent usage of destructuring assignment of props, state, and context

messages.noDestructPropsInSFCArg: Must never use destructuring props assignment in SFC argument
messages.noDestructContextInSFCArg: Must never use destructuring context assignment in SFC argument
messages.destructureInSignature: Must destructure props in the function signature.

docs.description: Disallow missing displayName in a React component definition

messages.noDisplayName: Component definition is missing display name
messages.noContextDisplayName: Context definition is missing display name

Disallow certain props on DOM Nodes

messages.propIsForbidden: Prop "{{prop}}" is forbidden on DOM Nodes

docs.description: Disallow certain elements
Disallow using another component's propTypes

messages.forbiddenPropType: Using propTypes from another component is not safe because they may be removed in production builds

docs.description: Disallow certain propTypes
Enforce a specific function type for function components

messages.function-declaration: Function component is not a function declaration
messages.function-expression: Function component is not a function expression
messages.arrow-function: Function component is not an arrow function

messages.suggestPair: Destructure useState call into value + setter pair

messages.invalidValue: An iframe element defines a sandbox attribute with invalid value "{{ value }}"
messages.invalidCombination: An iframe element defines a sandbox attribute with both allow-scripts and allow-same-origin which is invalid

messages.omitBoolean: Value must be omitted for boolean attribute `{{propName}}`
messages.setBoolean: Value must be set for boolean attribute `{{propName}}`
messages.omitPropAndBoolean: Value must be omitted for `false` attribute: `{{propName}}`

docs.description: Enforce or disallow spaces inside of curly braces in JSX attributes and expressions

Enforce closing tag location for multiline JSX

messages.onOwnLine: Closing tag of a multiline JSX expression must be on its own line.
messages.matchIndent: Expected closing tag to match indentation of opening.

docs.description: Enforce or disallow spaces inside of curly braces in JSX attributes and expressions

messages.noNewlineAfter: There should be no newline after '{{token}}'
messages.noNewlineBefore: There should be no newline before '{{token}}'
messages.noSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{token}}'
messages.noSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{token}}'

Enforce or disallow spaces around equal signs in JSX attributes

messages.noSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '='
messages.noSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '='

docs.description: Disallow file extensions that may contain JSX

messages.noJSXWithExtension: JSX not allowed in files with extension '{{ext}}'
messages.extensionOnlyForJSX: Only files containing JSX may use the extension '{{ext}}'

docs.description: Enforce proper position of the first property in JSX

messages.propOnNewLine: Property should be placed on a new line
messages.propOnSameLine: Property should be placed on the same line as the component declaration

messages.badHandlerName: Handler function for {{propKey}} prop key must be a camelCase name beginning with '{{handlerPrefix}}' only
messages.badPropKey: Prop key for {{propValue}} must begin with '{{handlerPropPrefix}}'

docs.description: Enforce JSX indentation
Enforce props indentation in JSX
Disallow missing `key` props in iterators/collection literals

messages.missingIterKey: Missing "key" prop for element in iterator
messages.missingIterKeyUsePrag: Missing "key" prop for element in iterator. Shorthand fragment syntax does not support providing keys. Use {{reactPrag}}.{{fragPrag}} instead
messages.missingArrayKey: Missing "key" prop for element in array
messages.missingArrayKeyUsePrag: Missing "key" prop for element in array. Shorthand fragment syntax does not support providing keys. Use {{reactPrag}}.{{fragPrag}} instead
messages.keyBeforeSpread: `key` prop must be placed before any `{...spread}, to avoid conflicting with Reacts new JSX transform: https://reactjs.org/blog/2020/09/22/introducing-the-new-jsx-transform.html`

docs.description: Enforce JSX maximum depth

messages.wrongDepth: Expected the depth of nested jsx elements to be <= {{needed}}, but found {{found}}.

docs.description: Enforce maximum of props on a single line in JSX

messages.newLine: Prop `{{prop}}` must be placed on a new line

docs.description: Require or prevent a new line after jsx elements and expressions.

messages.require: JSX element should start in a new line
messages.prevent: JSX element should not start in a new line
messages.allowMultilines: Multiline JSX elements should start in a new line

docs.description: Disallow `.bind()` or arrow functions in JSX props

messages.arrowFunc: JSX props should not use arrow functions
messages.func: JSX props should not use functions

docs.description: Disallow comments from being inserted as text nodes

messages.putCommentInBraces: Comments inside children section of tag should be placed inside braces

docs.description: Disallows JSX context provider values from taking values that will cause needless rerenders

messages.withIdentifierMsg: The '{{variableName}}' {{type}} (at line {{nodeLine}}) passed as the value prop to the Context provider (at line {{usageLine}}) changes every render. To fix this consider wrapping it in a useMemo hook.
messages.withIdentifierMsgFunc: The '{{variableName}}' {{type}} (at line {{nodeLine}}) passed as the value prop to the Context provider (at line {{usageLine}}) changes every render. To fix this consider wrapping it in a useCallback hook.
messages.defaultMsg: The {{type}} passed as the value prop to the Context provider (at line {{nodeLine}}) changes every render. To fix this consider wrapping it in a useMemo hook.
messages.defaultMsgFunc: The {{type}} passed as the value prop to the Context provider (at line {{nodeLine}}) changes every render. To fix this consider wrapping it in a useCallback hook.

docs.description: Disallow duplicate properties in JSX
Disallow problematic leaked values from being rendered

messages.noPotentialLeakedRender: Potential leaked value that might cause unintentionally rendered values or rendering crashes

docs.description: Disallow usage of string literals in JSX

messages.noStringsInJSX: Strings not allowed in JSX files: "{{text}}"
messages.literalNotInJSXExpression: Missing JSX expression container around literal string: "{{text}}"

docs.description: Disallow usage of `javascript:` URLs

messages.noScriptURL: A future version of React will block javascript: URLs as a security precaution. Use event handlers instead if you can. If you need to generate unsafe HTML, try using dangerouslySetInnerHTML instead.

docs.description: Disallow `target="_blank"` attribute without `rel="noreferrer"`

messages.noTargetBlankWithoutNoreferrer: Using target="_blank" without rel="noreferrer" (which implies rel="noopener") is a security risk in older browsers: see https://mathiasbynens.github.io/rel-noopener/#recommendations
messages.noTargetBlankWithoutNoopener: Using target="_blank" without rel="noreferrer" or rel="noopener" (the former implies the latter and is preferred due to wider support) is a security risk: see https://mathiasbynens.github.io/rel-noopener/#recommendations

docs.description: Disallow unnecessary fragments

messages.NeedsMoreChildren: Fragments should contain more than one child - otherwise, theres no need for a Fragment at all.
messages.ChildOfHtmlElement: Passing a fragment to an HTML element is useless.

docs.description: Require one JSX element per line

messages.moveToNewLine: `{{descriptor}}` must be placed on a new line

docs.description: Disallow undeclared variables in JSX
Disallow unnecessary JSX expressions when literals alone are sufficient or enforce JSX expressions on literals in JSX children or attributes

messages.missingCurly: Need to wrap this literal in a JSX expression.

messages.usePascalCase: Imported JSX component {{name}} must be in PascalCase
messages.usePascalOrSnakeCase: Imported JSX component {{name}} must be in PascalCase or SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE

docs.description: Enforce shorthand or standard form for React fragments

messages.fragmentsNotSupported: Fragments are only supported starting from React v16.2. Please disable the `react/jsx-fragments` rule in `eslint` settings or upgrade your version of React.

docs.description: Disallow multiple spaces between inline JSX props

messages.noLineGap: Expected no line gap between {{prop1}} and {{prop2}}
messages.onlyOneSpace: Expected only one space between {{prop1}} and {{prop2}}

Enforce defaultProps declarations alphabetical sorting

messages.propsNotSorted: Default prop types declarations should be sorted alphabetically

docs.description: Enforce props alphabetical sorting

messages.noUnreservedProps: A customized reserved first list must only contain a subset of React reserved props. Remove: {{unreservedWords}}
messages.listIsEmpty: A customized reserved first list must not be empty
messages.listReservedPropsFirst: Reserved props must be listed before all other props
messages.listCallbacksLast: Callbacks must be listed after all other props
messages.listShorthandFirst: Shorthand props must be listed before all other props
messages.listShorthandLast: Shorthand props must be listed after all other props
messages.listMultilineFirst: Multiline props must be listed before all other props
messages.listMultilineLast: Multiline props must be listed after all other props

docs.description: Enforce spacing before closing bracket in JSX

messages.noSpaceBeforeClose: A space is forbidden before closing bracket
messages.needSpaceBeforeClose: A space is required before closing bracket

messages.selfCloseSlashNoSpace: Whitespace is forbidden between `/` and `>`; write `/>`
messages.selfCloseSlashNeedSpace: Whitespace is required between `/` and `>`; write `/ >`
messages.closeSlashNoSpace: Whitespace is forbidden between `<` and `/`; write `</`
messages.closeSlashNeedSpace: Whitespace is required between `<` and `/`; write `< /`
messages.beforeSelfCloseNoSpace: A space is forbidden before closing bracket
messages.beforeSelfCloseNeedSpace: A space is required before closing bracket

messages.afterOpenNoSpace: A space is forbidden after opening bracket
messages.afterOpenNeedSpace: A space is required after opening bracket
messages.beforeCloseNoSpace: A space is forbidden before closing bracket

messages.beforeCloseNeedNewline: A newline is required before closing bracket

docs.description: Disallow React to be incorrectly marked as unused
Disallow variables used in JSX to be incorrectly marked as unused
Disallow missing parentheses around multiline JSX

messages.extraParens: Expected no parentheses around multilines JSX
messages.parensOnNewLines: Parentheses around JSX should be on separate lines

messages.neverValid: {{reportingValue}} is never a valid {{attributeName}} attribute value.
messages.noMethod: The {{attributeName}} attribute cannot be a method.

messages.notValidFor: {{reportingValue}} is not a valid {{attributeName}} attribute value for <{{elementName}}>.
messages.onlyMeaningfulFor: The {{attributeName}} attribute only has meaning on the tags: {{tagNames}}
messages.spaceDelimited: {{attributeName}} attribute values should be space delimited.

docs.description: Disallow when this.state is accessed within setState

messages.useCallback: Use callback in setState when referencing the previous state.

docs.description: Disallow adjacent inline elements not separated by whitespace.

messages.inlineElement: Child elements which render as inline HTML elements should be separated by a space or wrapped in block level elements.

docs.description: Disallow usage of Array index in keys

messages.noArrayIndex: Do not use Array index in keys

docs.description: Lifecycle methods should be methods on the prototype, not class fields

messages.lifecycle: {{propertyName}} is a React lifecycle method, and should not be an arrow function or in a class field. Use an instance method instead.

docs.description: Disallow passing of children as props

messages.nestChildren: Do not pass children as props. Instead, nest children between the opening and closing tags.
messages.passChildrenAsArgs: Do not pass children as props. Instead, pass them as additional arguments to React.createElement.
messages.nestFunction: Do not nest a function between the opening and closing tags. Instead, pass it as a prop.
messages.passFunctionAsArgs: Do not pass a function as an additional argument to React.createElement. Instead, pass it as a prop.
